name: ME CHICKEN RICE
address: 120 W 3rd St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: So good, very authentic. Low key and just what you need on a cold day in the city. Each time I go, it gets better. The consistency shows.
One of my fav lunch spot / nice staffs and healthy clean food. Their daikon soup is always delicious and nutritious.
Nice C'est super

Went for a lunch on a moving day. Tiny place with couple tables only, food is quickly prepared, great spot to get take out or just grab a quick meal. The Thai style chicken meat is very tender and juicy, the rice is tasty too with a broth on side. Portion is not too big but still full when finished whole set dish. Delicious and satisfied meal with a fair price! (forgot to take photos)
I highly recommend this restaurant. All the food is delicious
As good as any Khao man Kai you'll find outside of Thailand. It's a simple dish but hard to find here, and this place does it right.

Nothing beats the taste of a small, family run,  mom and pop restaurant because it‚Äôs the taste of home, care and love. This is the place to find that taste. I love the Thai chicken rice, in which the chicken is cooked with care, tender yet chewy with the right balance. But the overall street vibe is what sets it apart. I love hearing the Thai language spoken in the back and the laughters that permeate in the space. They also serve super fast, like lightening fast!
My comfort food and go-to place whenever I wanted to eat near NYU.

It was my first time here and I'm not a New Yorker, I'm just a tourist and they are very welcoming whether you are Thai or foreign, I guess they are friendly to everyone. The staff are lovely and friendly. The food doesn't take long time The restaurant is small but cozy. I noticed that they are always busy, so you can't guess when they are not busy. It's good to eat in or to take out. The food is delicious. What I like most about this restaurant is the staff or the owner. They are really lovely.
I came to Manhattan just to get the number 3 with wing zabb. Possibly the best chicken in NYC lol, you order and the food is immediate, hot, fresh, and filling
Extremely delicious and super friendly staff

ME Chicken Rice in the West Village is a hidden gem if you‚Äôre craving Thai-style chicken rice. I ordered the steamed chicken rice and it was tender, juicy, and paired perfectly with the fragrant ginger rice and flavorful sauces. The broth on the side was light but comforting, and the portion size was just right. The place itself is small and casual, more of a quick-stop or takeout spot, but the food really stands out for its authenticity and taste. Prices are fair for the neighborhood, and service was friendly and efficient. Definitely worth trying if you‚Äôre in the area and want something satisfying and different from the usual.

What a pleasant lunch, for less than $15, you get this meal. The rice wasn't ordinary white rice, but prepared with very delicious slightly sweet flavor, and the soup was also very healing, it seems to calm your nerves because of the richnessness of the radish. All in all, a great experience! Not to mention the wait time was less than a few minutes, and the food was fresh
The food is delicious. I fly to work here. I have to stop by to eat all the time. Recommended.
good affordable authentic thai food fast service
Great deal and portion, small place. But ok sauce.

So flavorful, fresh, and fast!!

SO GOOD!  I ordered #1 steamed chicken rice and #3 roasted chicken rice.  Despite the fact that they gave me fries instead of roasted, this place will be in my regular rotation going forward.

GET #1!!! chicken is great.  liver and other bits they give you are a pleasant surprise, but the rice!!  ZOMG SO FLAVORFUL!!!

I am so happy I walked in there today.

Cannnot wait to go back for more steamed and hope to try roasted soon!

8/10 No.2 Fried Chicken + Rice

Super tasty.
Amazing chicken, best I‚Äôve had in NYC. Takes me right back to Bangkok! Can‚Äôt recommend this place enough

Used to eat hainanese chicken all the time when i lived in bangkok, this is as good if not better than what I've had there. Such a gem. I love the roasted chicken here. Black pepper lover HEAVENNNNN. perfect rice taste and texture also. The soup is PERFECTLY seasoned and light and perfect wow.
Amazing Hainanese chicken, a super cozy place!
Amazing chicken rice. Super sweet staff

The food is very delicious. üòç

My favorite place for quick lunch near nyu & washington square park. Highly recommend the roasted chicken and the fried chicken! For fried chicken, better to eat while it‚Äôs still crunchy. Food came out early, and the price is really good considering the location.

This place is a hidden gem! I ordered the No. 2 Fried Chicken Rice, and it completely blew me away. I‚Äôve traveled to Thailand, but I‚Äôve never experienced ginger fried rice like this‚Äîit was so unique and flavorful that I couldn‚Äôt stop taking bites back to back. I received my order no more than 2 minutes after ordering, which was incredibly impressive. I‚Äôm already planning my next visit just to try the same plate again, and I‚Äôm seriously considering bringing some home after work!

The boneless fried chicken was absolutely perfect‚Äîjuicy and packed with outstanding flavors that really stood out. To top it all off, the chef personally thanked me for my service and even gave me a bottle of water on the house. It‚Äôs the little things that make a big difference. I will definitely be back‚Äîthis spot is worth every visit!

I love their Hainanese chicken rice (combo No. 1, that is) SO MUCH. Hands down more delicious than the ones I‚Äôve had in Hainan. The sauces are fantastic my mixed and a rather core part of the taste.

The Thai lady behind the counter is always very friendly. Service is fast. Limited seating but can always get a spot if you wait a few min. Every dish is flavorful. Soups that come with the meals are great too - memorably tasty broth that can probably help with sickness with its warmth and nutrition.

5 stars for 5 reasons

1. Best fried chicken I‚Äôve had in NY! So crispy and the chicken is fresh! So good!

2. The daikon soup is tasty and really complements the whole meal!

3. Price is phenomenal! 12.95 unbeatable!

4. Quality and quantity! Very good!

5. Nice folks and quick service!

Delicious! VERY generous portions and great price. The ginger sauce was nice and spicy. Three small tables and a street facing counter. People were in and out pretty quick. This is a very homey tasting dish! One caveat- do not recommend the matcha tea. The daikon soup was our favorite!!!

This place is AMAZING. So far have tried the steamed and roast chicken. The rice is aromatic and broth/ sauces are flavorful and fragrant with notes of ginger/ tamarind. Will be trying the fried chicken next!

A hole in the wall, self-service chicken rice joint. I actually liked the texture of the rice and the chicken. Filling portion, not too big or too small. It also comes with a clear soup on the side. They work fast, so it‚Äôs perfect if you‚Äôre‚Ä¶
Me Chicken Rice is a cute little spot, perfect for a quick, tasty bite. Their menu is simple but flavorful, making it an ideal stop when you‚Äôre on the go!

Visit this shop as if your life depended on it! This is the first piece of advice I will be giving others travelling to New York.  Rotating between the roasted chicken with rice and the daikon (mooli) soup is the most incredible comfort food experience you will ever have for $13. If you're feeling saucy, their spicy flavour wings are both juicy and crispy, and it's coating reminds you of 'nice n spicy' flavoured nik naks. The servers are also super polite and friendly. The shop is only small, but there were stools available both times I visited.

2nd visit: 02/2023

We missed this little shop so we dropped by today. This time, we went here in the afternoon. The shop was filled with many customers. They have high chairs next to the large glass window to look over the 3rd ave.

The food was absolutely delicious. We will definitely went back here soon.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
1st visit: 01/2023

We dropped by this restaurant close to the time they close. We bought Roasted Chicken over rice and a side of roasted chicken. The food was amazing. The chicken was very tender and tasty. The rice was very authentic and flavorful. We think they cooked the rice with chicken broth, which made the rice so yummy. The star of the dish was the ginger sauce. Totally recommend.

The portion was large. The set will come with Daikon soup. It is the Asian culture to have a simple soup with a heavy meal.

The staff made our food really quick and was very friendly.

The restaurant space is pretty small but very cozy and bright. The minus point was that they don‚Äôt have rest room. That was the reason we decided to have the food to go rather than sit in.

Tucked away in a humble corner, Me Chicken Rice might be easy to overlook, but once you try their food, it‚Äôs impossible to forget. This unassuming spot serves what is arguably one of the best chicken and rice dishes I‚Äôve ever tasted. I opted for the roasted chicken, and every bite was a testament to their dedication to quality. The chicken was fresh, incredibly juicy, and perfectly seasoned, with that ideal balance of crispy skin and tender meat. The rice was just as impressive‚Äîflavorful, fragrant, and cooked to perfection, making it more than just a side but a key part of the meal.

What sets Me Chicken Rice apart is the love they put into their food. It‚Äôs evident in every bite, from the quality of the ingredients to the careful preparation. It‚Äôs a small spot, but the success they‚Äôve achieved in mastering such a simple yet delicious dish is huge. Whether you‚Äôre a local or just passing through, Me Chicken Rice is a must-try for anyone who appreciates good, honest food.

This place smells amazing and super clean. Chrysanthemum Tea is very refreshing for a hot summer day. I ordered steamed and roasted chicken rice set, they are both delicious. Will definitely come back.

Great value and awesome taste, the Hainanese chicken rice here is ‚ÄúSECOND TO NONE‚Äú in the city. The chicken texture is silky and tender like tofu, with almost perfect proportion of fat and lean meat. The house-made ginger sauce nicely highlights the umami of the chicken flavor. The white pepper radish chicken soup that comes with the combo is also hearty.

If you come in a group and want some variety, this well-maintained hole-in-the-wall place also  offers other authentic yet affordable dishes. No wonder why it has gained such population despite the humble interior deco. Would highly recommend everyone to try.

Seriously so good. Got the steamed chicken rice. Ginger sauce was on point and the chicken incredibly tender. Daikon soup was really tasty too. Lady behind the counter was very nice. Highly recommend.

Got the zabb chicken over rice and it was 10/10 truly don‚Äôt know how it could be so good. The soup was 11/10 incredible too. So homey and filling and amazing. The rice is so FRAGRANT. I LOVED it here.

We got the steamed chicken, fried chicken, and spring rolls. All of it was delicious and was super fresh. The chicken is juicy and the rice is fragrant. Lots of flavor packed into very simple dishes. Sauces that came with the dishes were delicious as well. A little pricier than I‚Äôd want it to be, but I‚Äôd definitely go back at some point.

I wish I could live next door to this place. Hands down best chicken rice I‚Äôve had in the area, if not best in NYC. The roasted chicken rice is flavored and cooked to perfection, and don‚Äôt miss any of their other items. The chicken rice soup in particular warms my soul. The servers/owner are always kind and very quick to prepare your orders. Cannot recommend enough.

Having grown up eating Hainanese chicken rice, I had high expectations from this restaurant. I got the steamed chicken rice while my friends got the fried and roasted version. I can say that this chicken rice is as delicious as any of the‚Ä¶

Incredibly delicious chicken and rice. It‚Äôs like the Thai version of Hainanese chicken and comes with a hearty sauce and a soup. Great portion and friendly service as well. There‚Äôs three tables inside to sit down plus seating by the window.

I ordered the steamed chicken rice. I‚Äôm not sure what sauce was it but it‚Äôs between flavorful and a hint of spice which is not too much. The steamed chicken was so tender and flavorful and the rice had a hint of ginger which is even taste amazing. The lady who was working was so fast because I would have thought i would have to wait 5 mins for my order but it took 2 seconds üòÖ. It was worth the wait since I‚Äôm not always in the west village area and definitely going back again since it is a quick grab bite to go or to eat in the small place.
Around ten seats inside. Welcoming host. Good enough flavor with such price. Hope to have chopsticks as well.
Small hole in the wall but absolute fire. The chicken is tender, the daikon soup is soul-healing, everything tastes fresh. Super reasonably priced. Just go.

Great portions. 5/5
Great taste. 5/5
Food comes fast. 5/5
Small store, has about 3 tables and a long table facing the street.
We ordered No.1 Steamed chicken rice. It came with liver and gizzards. You can opt out those when ordering.
roasted chicken smelled and tasted amazing. it came with a lot of rice and hearty soup with radish. great meal

My favorite Hainanese chicken in Manhattan. I've been coming here for about a year. Their chicken is just as good as similar spots in Queens where I'm from. Great deal for a meal around the NYU area. They also started to sell french fries, chicken wings, potstickers, and spring rolls!

Small, barely any sitting ‚Ä¶ so plan accordingly.

Let me paint a picture‚Ä¶ you walk up the stairs and open the door to the right and BAM üí• hit with the flavourful smell of Thailand. Honestly I didn‚Äôt realize I was hungry until I opened the door.

Anyways, I ordered #3 which had ginger rice and the chicken was delicious ü§§. Made a tshirt out of the food because it was so good
Fast place for a nice meal or snack. The number one is great. The garlic sauce is awesome, too.

The food is so transnational but this one is exactly the real Thai taste. The only difference is the size! Try the chicken rice here if you want to know how it tastes like for the Thai interpretation. Tip: Ask the owners for the sweet thick soy sauce to add more taste‚Äôs dimension.

My absolute favorite restaurant in NYC right now. Delicious chicken, good portions, fast service, friendly staff. I always get the No. 1 for Steamed chicken rice. I tried the others options and while tasty, the No. 1 was still my favorite due to quantity of protein and meat.

Cheap, delicious, and fast. Went here instead of cauldron chicken, and eventually got cauldron in the future. This place is much better, and the combination of Garlic Ginger with steamed chicken is the best combo

The food was quite good, the lady in the restaurant very nice. I'm giving a low score because too much plastic is used in take out. Would be great if the restaurant can change to paper boxes and add the sauce to next to the chicken instead of using a separate plastic container.

So good! Came here with my college friend from Singapore who said this place tasted really authentic. I loved how the rice was flavored with broth and the chicken was cooked super tenderly. Simple but delicious. Super homey spot too~ Chicken and rice cost $10-11. Definitely would come back again! Thank you :)
I am a chicken rice lover, and it always reminds me of my childhood, I'm glad I've found this place. The service was friendly and the food tasted good. Recommendation!
A hidden gem! I love Thai food!!! The owner is so lovely and the drinks are sooo good! I will definitely be coming back.
This is the best food I‚Äôve had in a very long time. So so good. If I was a local I‚Äôd eat here all the time.
